item.title: Art add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Art add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "From this day to the ending of the world, But we in it shall be remembered- We few, we happy few, we band of brothers; For he to-day that sheds his blood with me Shall be my brother; be he ne’er so vile, This day shall gentle his condition; And gentlemen in England now-a-bed Shall think themselves accurs’d they were not here, And hold their manhoods cheap whiles any speaks That fought with us upon Saint Crispin’s day." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Art add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Art add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Art add a quote by Dylan Thomas
Art add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "And I'll stand on the ocean until I start sinking." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Art add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "He not busy being born is busy dying." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Art add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Life is more or less a lie, but then again, that's exactly the way we want it to be." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Art add a quote by Leo Durocher
item.description: "Baseball is like church. Many attend, few understand." -- Leo Durocher

item.title: Art add a quote by Red Barber
item.description: "Baseball is only dull to dull minds" -- Red Barber
